title: Therfield Walks

images.title: Mike W Hallett / Kings Ride
images.caption: Kings Ride. Therfield Heath is popular with walkers and golfers. But this part of the Heath alongside the A505 road is used for training race horses

images.title: Alison Rawson / Bench with a view
images.caption: Bench with a view. From its vantage point on one of the barrows, this bench commands a great view of the sports fields and the town of Royston.

images.title: Royston as seen from Therfield Heath by Michael Trolove, CC BY-SA 2.0 <https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/2.0>, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: Royston as seen from Therfield Heath

images.title: Stuart Warrington / Church Hill, Therfield Heath
images.caption: Church Hill. A Small area of sheep-grazed species-rich chalk grassland, including the rare pasque flower.

images.title: Peter O'Connor aka anemoneprojectors, CC BY-SA 2.0 <https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/2.0>, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: GOC Therfield to Sandon 068 Hope Cottages, Therfield

description: A circular walk from the village of Therfield in Hertfordshire. The walk explores the village before visiting Fox Covert Nature Reserve and Therfield Heath. The settlement is very attractive with a picturesque village green, pretty cottages and an historic pub dating back to the early 18th century. The route makes use of the Hertfordshire Chain Walk and the Icknield Way Path to create a circular route, taking you through the countryside surrounding the heath. It's a lovely place for a walk with splendid views from the high points and a wide variety of flora and fauna to enjoy. For an alternative shorter route through the area see the Royston Heath Walk .
